profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-09-25 15:55:13 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 137 pages of notes covering 33 lectures given by Violette De Mazia at the Barnes Foundation on 19th and 20th century art. These unauthorized notes include the orientation lecture, reading assignements, and class discussions.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel 4233 available at Archives of American Art offices, through interlibrary loan and at the Free Library of Philadelphia.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals returned to the lender, Janet Neville-Loper, after microfilming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Painter, art instructor; Wilmington, Del. Loper studied at the Barnes Foundation.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Edward Loper was given a copy of short hand notes taken in De Mazia's class by an unidentified student. Loper then had one of his students, Janet Neville, type the notes. Neville, who later became Loper's wife, kept a copy of the notes, and they were microfilmed in 1989 as part of AAA's Philadelphia Arts Documentation Project.

controlaccess.subject: Art, Modern -- 20th century -- History
